comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Fergal and Maureen's Wedding Could it be? I have redacted the surnames to protect the couple. The marriage between Fergal McXxxx, of Ardmalin, Donegal, and Maureen O'Xxxxx , eldest daughter of Sir.Cookie O'Xxxxx, of Swords, Co. Dublin, took place on Thursday, the 29th of February 1997, in the pretty parish church of the Star of the Sea, Malin Head, Clonca, Co Donegal. The service was performed by the Rev. Richard M. Lloyd, M.A., assisted by Canon Marconi and the Rev. J. Spooner. The bride, who was given away by her father Sir Cookie O'Xxxxx, was attired in a gown of Louisine satin, the skirt being trimmed with bandigued frills of accordion-pleated chiffon. Mr Lawrence French (Adelphi Quay, Waterford) was the best man and Miss Carol Spears (Kildare Street, Dublin) the Chief Bridesmaid. A Mr O'Dea ably assisted by the young Mr Poole took a few snaps of the happy couple on the day. The wedding was followed by an enormous reception at the The Seaview Tavern to which all the residents of the Townland of Ardmalin were invited. The loving and happily married couple are still living nearby with their three children Niall, John and Mogey and their stuffed dog NeLI !!!! :)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] You're a complete Looper! And I'm saying that affectionately. Arrived back from a day at me conference so rushed that it wasn't until I got to Sir Cookie O'Xxxxx that I realised you hadn't actually uncovered a complete family history just from two grafittied words on a wall in Malin Head...  :D

As [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] would say: "I'm off for a long lie down in a darkened room!"
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] What worried me was that some toff with my title had vandals for kids and in-laws.  I was going to track them down and sort them out until I realised that you were taking the mic:-)  By the way Oaktree Brian, herself and meself have a certain understanding (subject to terms and conditions) so don't be getting presumptious!

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02]  I really Should have included Oaktree Brian in the comment, perhaps

"The brides grandfather, Lord Brian O'Xxxxx, a widower, of 1976 Oaktree Lawn, Toronto, Canada, was also in attendance, dispite his great age (91) he made the long and arduous trip from Canada for the wedding of his favourite grand daughter, he struck up a lively liaison with Miss Carol Spears the Chief Bridesmaid!

comment._content: Any of you interested in Marconi (and within shouting distance of Howth) may like to know about this day-long celebration at the Hurdy Gurdy Radio Museum. It's on Saturday 20 April and the good people there would show you a very good time...
